last_episode_to_air.name: Tram Sign
last_episode_to_air.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim to get the best price for their items, including a butter churn, a pair of binoculars and a tram sign.

name: The Bidding Room
overview: Nigel Havers welcomes people with an item they’d like to sell, introducing them to a valuation expert who gives them the specialist information they need to drive a hard bargain. Tooled up with this information, Nigel guides the sellers through to the bidding room, where the five eager dealers square up to spend their money.

seasons.name: Series 1
seasons.overview: Sellers come face to face with five dealers who battle it out to make the highest bid.

seasons.name: Series 2
seasons.overview: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers compete to buy items brought in by the public.

seasons.name: Series 3
seasons.overview: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers compete to buy items brought in by the public.

seasons.name: Series 4
seasons.overview: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers compete to buy items brought in by the public.

seasons.name: Series 5
seasons.overview: Sellers come face to face with five dealers who battle it out to make the highest bid.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Five dealers bid against each other for items including a piece of hair-dressing history, a beloved toy, some classic furniture and an item saved from the tip.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: Five dealers bid against each other for a harmonica, a silver belt and an underwear ad.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: The dealers mull over a doll designed to teach resuscitation, a 19th- century credenza, an industrial theodolite and a collection of dairy artifacts.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: Five dealers compete to buy items including an unusual musical instrument, a wartime phone being sold for charity and a cake stand, with cakes thrown in.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: The dealers bid against each other to secure a vintage fairground game, a Chinese inkwell, a toy pedal car and a Victorian watchman’s clock.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: The dealers bid on a Hornby train set, some crystalware and a catalogue from an auction to raise money for the families of the victims of the Titanic disaster.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: Five dealers bid against each other to buy a model giraffe, a snuff box and a set of Matchbox cars.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: Five dealers compete to buy today’s items: some pottery saved from the tip, two unusual fire screens, a mirror and an industrial fire extinguisher.

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: Nigel stands on seller Chris as he lies on the bed of nails he wants to sell to one of the dealers. Some Japanese whiskey and a classic Chopper bike are also on offer.

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: The dealers compete to buy a model spitfire, a pair of gilt cherubs, two ancient Celtic stone heads and a retro pub sign from a West Midland brewery.

episodes.name: Episode 11
episodes.overview: Five dealers bid against each other to buy four new items: a vintage bucket with a dark past, a beautiful jewellery box, two chairs that bamboozle them and an antique foot warmer.

episodes.name: Episode 12
episodes.overview: Can four new sellers persuade the dealers to part with their cash for a watercolour painting, a vintage walking stick, a classic toy and some retro furniture?

episodes.name: Episode 13
episodes.overview: The dealers bid on a collection of printing plates, a retro Olivetti typewriter, a toy steam engine and a prop from a Terry Pratchett film.

episodes.name: Episode 14
episodes.overview: Five dealers compete to buy a clock by the British horologist Charles Frodsham, a lottery machine, a handsome Victorian chair and a vintage coffee set.

episodes.name: Episode 15
episodes.overview: Five dealers bid against each other for a vintage car lighter, a Georgian needlework box, a 1970s musical drinks decanter and a collection of Second World War memorabilia.

episodes.name: Episode 16
episodes.overview: In the Bidding Room today, the dealers compete to buy a Danish silver bracelet, a pair of Victorian horse hair singers, a set of candlesticks and two mid-century modern chairs.

episodes.name: Episode 17
episodes.overview: Today’s sellers bring in some hidden treasure, two unusual machines, some Scandi furniture and a beautiful pocket watch. Will the dealers bid up to the prices the sellers want?

episodes.name: Episode 18
episodes.overview: Five dealers compete to buy items including an unusual musical instrument, a perfume bottle being sold to help a three-legged dog and a medical item with a curious smell.

episodes.name: Episode 19
episodes.overview: Five dealers compete to buy an old English sheep dog from Stoke pottery Beswick and a preserve bowl by renowned potter Clarice Cliff.

episodes.name: Episode 20
episodes.overview: In the Bidding Room today, the dealers go head to head over a religious statue, a pair of Bakelite phones, a glimpse into the future and a piece of rock n roll history.

episodes.name: Episode 21
episodes.overview: Five dealers compete to buy a vintage Steiff teddy bear, a Georgian nutcracker, a very special bottle of wine and a retro tin toy.

episodes.name: Episode 22
episodes.overview: Five dealers compete to buy an Edwardian shoe closet, a bronze racehorse, a 17th-century writing desk and a set of commemorative Concorde service medals.

episodes.name: Episode 23
episodes.overview: Four new sellers arrive with everything from doll-head moulds to movie posters and Scandi furniture. So will the dealers bid, and will the sellers get the prices they want?

episodes.name: Episode 24
episodes.overview: Five dealers bid against each other to buy a vintage pommel horse, a French wedding globe and an intriguing wooden toy.

episodes.name: Episode 25
episodes.overview: Four new sellers arrive hoping to persuade the dealers to bid against each other for a royal coin collection, two unique mirrors, a Russian-themed barometer and an ice shaver.

episodes.name: Episode 26
episodes.overview: Today a Danish rarity, some Indian history, Italian jewellery and a ship's wheel are brought in. Will the dealers bid on them, and will the sellers get the money they want?

episodes.name: Episode 27
episodes.overview: Wannabe dealer Alfie, aged just 11, tries to sell his scooter to the dealers. They are also offered a unique maths tool, an unusual birthing chair and a 1930s shop till.

episodes.name: Episode 28
episodes.overview: Four new sellers arrive with everything from a penny farthing bike to a block of silver. So will the dealers bid, and will the sellers get the prices they’re after?

episodes.name: Episode 29
episodes.overview: Five dealers bid against each other to buy items brought in by the public, including a glass chandelier from Venice and a vintage table hockey game.

episodes.name: Episode 30
episodes.overview: Five dealers are offered a collection of 1940s costume drawings, an Edwardian safe, some unusual figurines and a very old Corpus Christi. Will they be tempted to buy?

1.name: Series 1
1.overview: Sellers come face to face with five dealers who battle it out to make the highest bid.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: New series. Nigel Havers returns with the programme in which five dealers bid against one another to buy intriguing items brought in by members of the public. The opening edition features a tribal mask, avintage seed drill, adecorative press, a toy horse and a mysterious Edwardian piece.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presents the programme in which five dealers bid against one another to buy a pedal car, an Edwardian card table, a quirky voice box and a mystery pot.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers bid against each other for items brought in by the public, including odd medical models, a knife sharpener, a drinks cabinet and a toy milk cart.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers welcomes four more sellers to the Bidding Room, where they try to sell items to five professional dealers who are on the lookout for interesting pieces, with help from expert Simon Bower. Here, the dealers are offered to chance to bid on a vintage stereoscope, two gigantic apothecary glasses and a children's game thought to be from the 19th century.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: Deep in the Yorkshire countryside, Nigel Havers welcomes five people with intriguing pieces they are hoping to sell. To help them before they face the dealers, Nigel introduces them to resident valuation expert Simon, who has been an auctioneer for nearly 30 years. Dealers then bid for a lamp, Victorian wall mirror, Black Forest inkwell and a quirky sideboard.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: A group of dealers bid against each other for items collected by the public including two teddies, an Islamic tile, a painting and a chair brought in by a 12-year-old boy.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers bid against each other for items brought in by the public. Today a room divider, two Victorian love hearts, a carved door and a French salon sign.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers bid against each other for items brought in by the public, including an unusual Asian drum, an Argentinian belt and charming push-a-long toy.

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: The dealers are offered to chance to bid on a spy kit, a solid silver fruit bowl, a vintage coffee table, a tribal paddle and an architect's drawing board. Hosted by Nigel Havers.

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers and expert auctioneer Simon Bower welcome five more people to the Bidding Room with another batch of weird and wonderful lots. The dealers bid against each other on a fairground dodgem, two figurines, a pair of ornate candlesticks, a vintage garden sprayer and a rescued mannequin.

episodes.name: Episode 11
episodes.overview: Five dealers bid against one another to buy a collection of curiosities, an unusual chair, a mask, candlesticks from a famous maker, and a writing slope. Nigel Havers presents.

episodes.name: Episode 12
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presents the show in which five dealers bid to buy a retro coat stand, a train set, an unusual chair, some maritime history and a quirky house-clearance find.

episodes.name: Episode 13
episodes.overview: The dealers bid against each other on a plate with a famous name on it, a light from an operating theatre, a puzzle box and some Chinese silver - as well as a quirky orange item.

episodes.name: Episode 14
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers and expert auctioneer Simon Bower welcome five more people to the Bidding Room with another batch of weird and wonderful lots. The dealers bid against each other on two very decorative perfume bottles, an unusual box, two show-stopping pieces of African art, some rare ceramics and a unique light fitting.

episodes.name: Episode 15
episodes.overview: Five dealers bid against one another to buy a spice box, two Chinese statues, a funfair horse, a 1900s cabinet and a dummy called Steve. Nigel Havers presents.

episodes.name: Episode 16
episodes.overview: Five dealers bid against one another to buy two mannequins, a Moorcroft vase, an electric massager, a religious piece of art and a curious ladder. With Nigel Havers.

episodes.name: Episode 17
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presents the show in which five dealers bid to buy a unique 1960s vase, a curious mirror, two chalkware statues and a troll called Trotter.

episodes.name: Episode 18
episodes.overview: The dealers bid against each other on a pair of 1930s suitcases, a wind-up tin toy, a magic lantern, a silver condiment holder and a table and chair made from a fairground car.

episodes.name: Episode 19
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers welcomes five more sellers to the Bidding Room, where they try to sell items to five professional dealers who are on the lookout for interesting pieces, with help from expert Simon Bower. Here, the dealers bid against each other on a vintage pub game, a small and mysterious statue and an apothecary set complete with tiny weights.

episodes.name: Episode 20
episodes.overview: Five dealers bid against each other for items brought in by the public, including navigation lights, a watch repair kit, a vintage corkscrew, a mirror and two plaster heads.

episodes.name: Episode 21
episodes.overview: Five dealers bid against each other for items brought in by the public including a set of soda syphons, a collection of football figures and a curious and shocking machine.

episodes.name: Episode 22
episodes.overview: The dealers bid against each other on items including a vintage train set, a set of mid-century chairs, a 1940s style microphone, and an old butchers block.

episodes.name: Episode 23
episodes.overview: The dealers bid against each other on a childhood Viewmaster collection, a set of art deco candle holders and an apothecary box. Presented by Nigel Havers.

episodes.name: Episode 24
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers welcomes five more sellers to the Bidding Room, where they try to sell items to five professional dealers who are on the lookout for interesting pieces, with help from expert Simon Bower. Here, dealers Adi, Melissa, JB, Moses, Lucy, Samantha and Ian bid against one another on a set of mid-century cinema-style seats, Victorian wooden spinning tops, a silver cigarette case, a creepy head-shaped pot and an iconic 1960s movie poster.

episodes.name: Episode 25
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presents as five dealers bid against one another to buy a vintage pedal car, a dentist's chair, a copper and brass desktop fan and a rickshaw. Last in the series.

2.name: Series 2
2.overview: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers compete to buy items brought in by the public.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Five dealers compete to buy medical posters and a miniature skeleton, industrial laundry carts, a boudoir stool, and a womble space hopper. Presented by Nigel Havers.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: There are no live broadcasts scheduled for this show. But it is available via the streaming provider below.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers bid to buy items brought in by the public, including an art deco cinema seat, a pair of 1950s toy poodles and a goffering iron.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: Sisters Georgia and Mimi with a curious item they inherited from their grandfather. Their anatomical spider model is sure to catch the eyes of the dealers, but will anyone be brave enough to buy it? Other items appraised by five battling dealers include a Keswick light fitting and a gallery sign from a famous Cornish artist. Presented by Nigel Havers.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: Matt's antique vibration device is sure to create a buzz in the Bidding Room, but will he reach his desired price? Other items appraised by five battling dealers include a pair of 18th-century ice skates and a 1960s piece of iconic design. Presented by Nigel Havers.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: Five dealers bid against one another on a wind-up toy monkey, a set of polished samovars, some stained-glass windows, an old platform ticket machine, and a unique antique game.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public, including a 1970s film poster, some filigree miniatures and a bust called Fred the head.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: Items include a coin-operated giraffe, a Thomas the Tank Engine pedal car, a dynamite detonator and a bubble gum dispenser repurposed as a lamp.

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: Five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public. First through the doors is Chris with an ornate lead cherub he believes began life as part of a water feature in a stately home. Other items include a butterfly mirror and an Alice in Wonderland tin. Presented by Nigel Havers.

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: Five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public. First through the doors is Rebekah, who hopes her ornate pair of grand brass candelabras with delicate milk glass flowers will secure her a good deal. Other items include a complete set of Star Wars figurines and a double-sided hand-painted dodgem sign. Presented by Nigel Havers.

episodes.name: Episode 11
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers bid to buy items brought in by the public, including a vintage hairdressing collection, a WWII flying helmet and a unique chair.

episodes.name: Episode 12
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers bid against each other to buy items brought in by the public, including a Kentucky Derby fairground ride, antique dumbbells and a Dinky toy collection.

episodes.name: Episode 13
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers welcomes four more sellers to the Bidding Room, where they try to sell items to professional dealers who are on the lookout for interesting pieces, with help from expert Simon Bower.

episodes.overview: Nigel Havers welcomes five more sellers to the Bidding Room, where they try to sell items to professional dealers who are on the lookout for interesting pieces, with help from expert Simon Bower.

episodes.name: Episode 23
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers welcomes five more sellers to the Bidding Room, where they try to sell items to professional dealers who are on the lookout for interesting pieces, with help from expert Simon Bower.

episodes.name: Episode 24
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers welcomes five more sellers to the Bidding Room, where they try to sell items to professional dealers who are on the lookout for interesting pieces, with help from expert Simon Bower.

episodes.name: Episode 25
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers welcomes five more sellers to the Bidding Room, where they try to sell items to professional dealers who are on the lookout for interesting pieces, with help from expert Simon Bower. First through the doors is Vivian, with a unique miniature gardening kit. It fascinates Nigel and Simon, but will our dealers love it enough to reach the price tag that Vivian has in mind?

4.name: Series 4
4.overview: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers compete to buy items brought in by the public.

episodes.name: Jack-in-the-Box
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as sellers aim for top prices on items, including a film vending machine, The Bridge Over the River Kwai model, a gold changer, a jack-in-the-box and a chemistry set.

episodes.name: Theatrical Clown
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim to get the best price for their items, including a dressing screen, a coracle, a toy steam engine, a car mascot and a theatrical prop clown.

episodes.name: Leather Pig
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim for the best price for their items, including iconic London signage, a footstool, a musical decanter, a wind-up tin toy and a dental polisher.

episodes.name: Skeleton Statue
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim to get the best price for their items, including a village fete sign, a telescope, a Martaban jar, skeleton statue and a bird automaton.

episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim to get the best price for their items, including a bard chair, a Bob Marley poster, WWI postcards, an antique golf caddy and a classic car.

episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim to get the best price for their items, including a music box, chess mould, a gallery painting, a zoetrope and a World War II compass.

episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim to get the best price for their items, including a needlework book, a postbox, an anatomy torso, a stereoscope and a Troika pot.

episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim to get the best price for their items, including a wash tub, an autocycle, a Rowntree’s advertising sign, a Victorian glass ship and a rocking horse.

episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim to get the best price for their items, including a bird cage, marriage cloth, model car, arcade horse and a picture of Earth from space.

episodes.name: Accordion
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim to get the best price for their items, including a picnic set, German lamps, dining table, an accordion and Lego structure.

episodes.name: Cash Till
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim for the best price for their items, including 1950s swimwear, a WWI memorial sculpture, mourning jewellery, a brass till and a rare fashion doll.

episodes.name: Dairy Separator
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim for the best price for their items, including golf clubs, a chandelier, a veterinary chest, a Ray Lonsdale sculpture and a dairy separator.

episodes.name: Welsh Blanket
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim to get the best price for their items, including a set of Hovis signs, a Welsh blanket, brailler, an antique travel cot and some pedestal paper weights.

episodes.name: Circus Sign
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim to get the best price for their items, including Italian paintings, a doll's house, a circus sign, an advertising elephant and a Tri-ang train.

episodes.name: Pigeon Clock
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim to get the best price for their items, including a Georgian painter’s box, a butter churn, some WWII silk maps, a wooden stool and a pigeon clock.

episodes.name: Fairground Sign
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim to get the best price for their items, including a meat press, a whisky bottle, some fairground signs, a 1930s vanity case and a Chinese card box.

episodes.name: Toy Phone
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim for the best price for their items, including stilts, perfume bottles, furniture locks, a ranch phone toy and a nautical trio.

episodes.name: Accounts Ledgers
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim to get the best price for their items, including a mini sewing machine, a silver canteen, an accordion, gingerbread moulds and some old accounts ledgers.

episodes.name: Exercise Bike
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim for the best price for their items, including an étagère, a German pendant light, some napkin clips, a spinning wheel and an exercise bike.

episodes.name: Football Table
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as four sellers aim to get the best price for their items, including a vintage poster, a football table, a globe and a box of ephemera.

episodes.name: Tram Sign
episodes.overview: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim to get the best price for their items, including a butter churn, a pair of binoculars and a tram sign.

5.name: Series 5
5.overview: Sellers come face to face with five dealers who battle it out to make the highest bid.
